main_definition: To become unsteady or lose balance while standing, leading to a fall.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Loss of control over physical body movement and position.
meanings_and_examples.example: The slippery ice caused her to fell from the skating rink.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A sudden descent or drop in value, number, quality, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: The stock market took a dramatic fall this morning.
During the logging season, they fell many trees to make space for new saplings.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be overcome by an emotion or feeling strongly.
meanings_and_examples.example: He was so shocked when he heard the news that it seemed like his world fell apart.
